titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Terrence O'Flaherty Papers PASC.0026

physdesc.extent: (14 unprocessed record cartons, 10 unprocessed flat boxes)

did.abstract: Terrence O'Flaherty worked as television critic for the San Francisco Chronicle from 1952-1986. The bulk of the collection consists of television stills and promotional material collected by O'Flaherty during the course of his 37-year journalistic career. Additionally included are scrapbooks documenting his newspaper columns, subject files containing research materials, and a small amount of correspondence and other writings by O'Flaherty.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIO MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audio materials. For information about the access status of the material that you are looking for, refer to the Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed audio materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Terrence O'Flaherty, 1986. Addition to the collection gift of Lynn Hickerson, 2007.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Terrence O'Flaherty papers (Collection PASC 26). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by UCLA Library Arts Special Collections staff, pre-1999. Additions processed by Alexandra Apolloni and Julie Graham.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Terrence O'Flaherty was born in Iowa in 1917, and raised in Los Angeles. He graduated with a BA from the University of California, Berkeley, and went on to work as a fact checker at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. He served as a communications officer in the US Navy during World War II. His first newspaper position was with the Santa Monica Independent, in 1949, and in 1950, he began working for the San Francisco Chronicle, where he would remain until his retirement in 1986.

O'Flaherty was one of the first commentators to write seriously about the then-emerging medium of television. In addition to writing his widely read television column for the San Francisco Chronicle, O'Flaherty was involved with a number of other television-related activities. From 1952 to 1984, he was a member of the board of the Peabody Awards; and in 1961 and 1962, he hosted PM West, a nightly news show, broadcast from San Francisco.

In 1974, O'Flaherty was nominated for the Pulitzer Prize, and in 1988, was presented with an Emmy Award. In 1995, he published the book Masterpiece Theatre, a retrospective look at the PBS series of the same name. Terrence O'Flaherty died of pancreatic cancer in 2001, at the age of 83.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material related to television critic and newspaper columnist, Terrence O'Flaherty. The bulk of the collection is television stills and promotional material that O'Flaherty collected over the course of his 37-year career. The stills date from approximately 1952-1990, and document television programs from all of the major networks. The promotional material includes press kits from television programs and networks, as well as print advertisements, invitations, and other promotional items sent to O'Flaherty. Also included are scrapbooks of his many newspaper columns.

Also included in the collection is a small amount of cards, notes, and column reader letters; subject files which appear to have been assembled by O'Flaherty on a range of television-related themes; television scripts and recordings sent to O'Flaherty to promote television programing; and a small quantity of O'Flaherty's writings. Additionally, there publications covering the history, development, economics, sociology and technology of television. Some of the book publications are signed or contain personal notes to O'Flaherty and may contain additional news release or promotional material in the item.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Scrapbooks
Subject files
Writings
Oral history
Correspondence
Stills
Promotional material
Publications
Sound recordings

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Morrie Gelman Papers (Collection 292). Available at Library Special Collections, Young Research Library, UCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The majority of the scrapbooks document O'Flaherty's career as a newspaper columnist. They consist of clippings of O'Flaherty's writings for newspapers including the San Francisco Chronicle and the Santa Monica Independent. Some of the scrapbooks also include reader mail responses to O'Flaherty's columns. A small number of books contain other clippings and television publicity photographs. Additionally there is a scrapbook presented to O'Flaherty on the television program This Is Your Life in 1954.

arrangement.p: The files in the series are arranged alphabetically by name or subject titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series consists of subject files that appear to have been compiled and utilized by O'Flaherty over the course of his writing career by. They contain research material such as clippings, photographs, and notes on a variety of topics. The bulk of the files document performers and media personalities, including Julie Andrews, Pearl Bailey, Tallulah Bankhead, Noel Coward, Bette Davis, Ethel Merman, Elvis Presley, O.J. Simpson, Gore Vidal, Lawrence Welk, and among others. Also included are files about events, such as the Academy Awards, and files containing a small amount of television and motion picture stills.

phystech.p: SERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 6 tapes with sides labeled 1-9; 3 tapes labeled June 13 1989; 1 tape each labeled 21 Feb 89, May 24 1989, 27 June 1989, Test Tape, and The Making of an Oral History; two unidentified tapes; and handwritten notes. From box marked Clow Oral History Tapes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the series are cards and notes sent to O'Flaherty by friends, family, businesses, and personalities. Among the individuals are Perry Como, Bing Crosby, Carol Channing, Phyllis Diller, Jackie Gleason, Merv Griffin, Rock Hudson, Bob Hope, Gladys Knight and the Pips, Liberace, Ronald and Nancy Reagan, William Shatner, Red Skelton, Barbara Stanwyck, Danny Thomas, Marlo Thomas, Lawrence Welk, Adam West, Robert Young, and other notable public figures. Networks and studios represented include ABC, CBS, HBO, NBC, and Walt Disney, and local broadcasters such as KPIX-5, KRON-TV and KQED. There is also a small amount of correspondence that is primarily reader mail, and a program and correspondence related to the 1953 San Francisco's Hundred Leaders of Tomorrow event, where O'Flaherty was honored.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged in loose chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the series are black and white television stills, many with caption sheets providing program/series titles, names of performer(s), air date, and occasionally a brief summary of the program or scene depicted. Included are a combination of scene shots of broadcasts, rehearsal shots, publicity stills of individuals and cast members. Additionally, there are stills of music and dance programs aired on television, photographs of sports figures, politicians, and other community and public leaders, and a host of famous and infamous individuals from American social and pop-cultural life.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged both chronologically and alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series consists of press kits, print advertisements, preview invitations, and other promotional and souvenir objects pertaining to television programs and networks. Television program press kits may contain one or more of the following: detailed plots summaries, background information, lists of performers and information about their careers and off-camera lives, lists of production credits, information about sponsors and advertising agencies, and background information about the origin and development of programs. Some kits also mention production techniques used in creating the show, and some include favorable print reviews and productions stills. Network corporate press represent various networks' seasonal offerings of evening series, mini-series, late night shows, news and religious programs, and sports, etc. They include fact sheets describing the content of various shows, introducing performers and hosts, executive and production personnel, and sponsors and advertisers.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The sereies is arranged in a loose alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series includes script materials that appear to have been sent to O'Flaherty to promote television programs or for his comment. The majority of items represent news shows and documentaries.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items are organized alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series includes books and a small number research reports, periodicals, books, and other publications collected by O'Flaherty. The publications cover the history, development, economics, sociology and technology of television. Some of the books are signed or contain personal notes to O'Flaherty; some books may contain additional news release or promotional material in the item.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in a loose alphabetical order by publication title.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. For information about the access status of the material that you are looking for, refer to the Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the file levels. All requests to access processed audiovisual materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The small number of sound recordings were produced to promote particular television programs, and distributed to media professionals, critics, and journalists, and for the most part were unavailable to the general public.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: Audio materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.
